name: Classic Stars in Curious Movies Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Ray Milland starred in classics such as "Dial M for Murder" and "Lost Weekend". He also starred in some lesser movies. Which of the following is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
The Raven.

	"Raven" was one of many Vincent Price movies based on works (or titles, anyway) by Poe. "Heads" was a weird movie. "Frogs was a "monsters-on-the-loose" tale. "Burial" was (loosely) based on a short story by Poe.

questions.text: Joan Crawford is a legend, but not all of her movies were impressive. In which of the following movies did she star?
Louis Jourdan was the dapper star of "Gigi", but he also starred in lesser movies. Which of these James Bond movies included Jourdan in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Octopussy.

	How do you keep a straight face when you deliver lines like: "Octopussy, Octopussy ..."?

questions.text: Which of the following legends starred in "Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?"
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	A strange role in a strange movie.

questions.text: Which of the following actors starred in "The Mother Lode"?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	Don't bother to watch.

questions.text: "Hush, Hush, Sweet Charlotte" was a follow-up to "Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?". Which one of these classic actresses played one of the two starring roles?
What acting legend came out of a long retirement to appear in "Ragtime"?
questions.explanation:
James Cagney.

	He looked so old.

questions.text: Barbara Stanwyck, another giant, popped up in a key role in a tv mini-series late in her career. Which one?
questions.explanation:
The Thorn Birds.

	She'd already ventured into tv with "The Big Valley" tv series.

questions.text: "Crack in the World" was a sci-fi effort by what actor?
"Die! Die! My Darling" starred which screen legend?
questions.explanation:
Tallulah Bankhead.

	Why? Why? My goodness!
